verses.verse: And the famine<WH7458> was sore<WH3515> in the land.<WH776>

And it came to pass,<WH1961> when<WH834> they had eaten up<WH3615> <WH398> <WH853> the corn<WH7668> which<WH834> they had brought<WH935> out of Egypt,<WH4480> <WH4714> their father<WH1> said<WH559> unto<WH413> them, Go again,<WH7725> buy<WH7666> us a little<WH4592> food.<WH400>

And Judah<WH3063> spoke<WH559> unto<WH413> him, saying,<WH559> The man<WH376> did solemnly protest<WH5749> <WH5749> unto us, saying,<WH559> Ye shall not<WH3808> see<WH7200> my face,<WH6440> except<WH1115> your brother<WH251> be with<WH854> you.
If <WH518> thou wilt<WH3426> send<WH7971> <WH853> our brother<WH251> with<WH854> us, we will go down<WH3381> and buy<WH7666> thee food: <WH400>

But if<WH518> thou wilt not<WH369> send<WH7971> him, we will not<WH3808> go down:<WH3381> for<WH3588> the man<WH376> said<WH559> unto<WH413> us, Ye shall not<WH3808> see<WH7200> my face,<WH6440> except<WH1115> your brother<WH251> be with<WH854> you.
And Israel<WH3478> said,<WH559> Wherefore<WH4100> dealt ye so ill<WH7489> with me, as to tell<WH5046> the man<WH376> whether ye had yet<WH5750> a brother?<WH251>

And they said,<WH559> The man<WH376> asked us straitly<WH7592> <WH7592> of our state, and of our kindred,<WH4138> saying,<WH559> Is your father<WH1> yet<WH5750> alive?<WH2416> have<WH3426> ye another brother?<WH251> and we told<WH5046> him according to<WH5921> the tenor<WH6310> of these<WH428> words:<WH1697> could we certainly know<WH3045> <WH3045> that<WH3588> he would say,<WH559> Bring your brother down?<WH3381> <WH853> <WH251>

And Judah<WH3063> said<WH559> unto<WH413> Israel<WH3478> his father,<WH1> Send<WH7971> the lad<WH5288> with<WH854> me, and we will arise<WH6965> and go;<WH1980> that we may live,<WH2421> and not<WH3808> die,<WH4191> both<WH1571> we,<WH587> and<WH1571> thou,<WH859> and also<WH1571> our little ones.<WH2945>

I <WH595> will be surety<WH6148> for him; of my hand<WH4480> <WH3027> shalt thou require<WH1245> him: if<WH518> I bring<WH935> him not<WH3808> unto<WH413> thee, and set<WH3322> him before<WH6440> thee, then let me bear the blame<WH2398> forever:<WH3605> <WH3117>
For <WH3588> except<WH3884> we had lingered,<WH4102> surely<WH3588> now<WH6258> we had returned<WH7725> this<WH2088> second time.<WH6471>

And their father<WH1> Israel<WH3478> said<WH559> unto<WH413> them, If<WH518> it must be so<WH3651> now,<WH645> do<WH6213> this;<WH2063> take<WH3947> of the best fruits<WH4480> <WH2173> in the land<WH776> in your vessels,<WH3627> and carry down<WH3381> the man<WH376> a present,<WH4503> a little<WH4592> balm,<WH6875> and a little<WH4592> honey,<WH1706> spices,<WH5219> and myrrh,<WH3910> nuts,<WH992> and almonds: <WH8247>

And take<WH3947> double<WH4932> money<WH3701> in your hand;<WH3027> and the money<WH3701> that was brought again<WH7725> in the mouth<WH6310> of your sacks,<WH572> carry it again<WH7725> in your hand;<WH3027> peradventure<WH194> it<WH1931> was an oversight: <WH4870>
Take <WH3947> also your brother,<WH251> and arise,<WH6965> go again<WH7725> unto<WH413> the man: <WH376>

And God<WH410> Almighty<WH7706> give<WH5414> you mercy<WH7356> before<WH6440> the man,<WH376> that he may send away<WH7971> <WH853> your other<WH312> brother,<WH251> and Benjamin.<WH1144> If<WH834> I<WH589> be bereaved<WH7921> of my children, I am bereaved.<WH7921>

And the men<WH376> took<WH3947> <WH853> that<WH2063> present,<WH4503> and they took<WH3947> double<WH4932> money<WH3701> in their hand,<WH3027> and Benjamin;<WH1144> and rose up,<WH6965> and went down<WH3381> to Egypt,<WH4714> and stood<WH5975> before<WH6440> Joseph.<WH3130>

And when Joseph<WH3130> saw<WH7200> <WH853> Benjamin<WH1144> with<WH854> them, he said<WH559> to the ruler of<WH834> <WH5921> his house,<WH1004> Bring<WH935> <WH853> these men<WH376> home,<WH1004> and slay,<WH2873> <WH2874> and make ready;<WH3559> for<WH3588> these men<WH376> shall dine<WH398> with<WH854> me at noon.<WH6672>
And the man<WH376> did<WH6213> as<WH834> Joseph<WH3130> bade;<WH559> and the man<WH376> brought<WH935> <WH853> the men<WH376> into Joseph's<WH3130> house.<WH1004>

And the men<WH376> were afraid,<WH3372> because<WH3588> they were brought<WH935> into Joseph's<WH3130> house;<WH1004> and they said,<WH559> Because of<WH5921> <WH1697> the money<WH3701> that was returned<WH7725> in our sacks<WH572> at the first time<WH8462> are we<WH587> brought in;<WH935> that he may seek occasion<WH1556> against<WH5921> us, and fall<WH5307> upon<WH5921> us, and take<WH3947> us for bondmen,<WH5650> and our asses.<WH2543>
And they came near<WH5066> to<WH413> the steward<WH376> <WH834> <WH5921> of Joseph's<WH3130> house,<WH1004> and they communed<WH1696> with<WH413> him at the door<WH6607> of the house,<WH1004>
And said,<WH559> O<WH994> sir,<WH113> we came indeed down<WH3381> <WH3381> at the first time<WH8462> to buy<WH7666> food: <WH400>

And it came to pass,<WH1961> when<WH3588> we came<WH935> to<WH413> the inn,<WH4411> that we opened<WH6605> <WH853> our sacks,<WH572> and, behold,<WH2009> every man's<WH376> money<WH3701> was in the mouth<WH6310> of his sack,<WH572> our money<WH3701> in full weight:<WH4948> and we have brought it again<WH7725> <WH853> in our hand.<WH3027>

And other<WH312> money<WH3701> have we brought down<WH3381> in our hands<WH3027> to buy<WH7666> food:<WH400> we cannot<WH3808> tell<WH3045> who<WH4310> put<WH7760> our money<WH3701> in our sacks.<WH572>

And he said,<WH559> Peace<WH7965> be to you, fear<WH3372> not:<WH408> your God,<WH430> and the God<WH430> of your father,<WH1> hath given<WH5414> you treasure<WH4301> in your sacks:<WH572> I had<WH935> your money.<WH3701> And he brought Simeon out<WH3318> <WH853> <WH8095> unto<WH413> them.

And the man<WH376> brought<WH935> <WH853> the men<WH376> into Joseph's<WH3130> house,<WH1004> and gave<WH5414> them water,<WH4325> and they washed<WH7364> their feet;<WH7272> and he gave<WH5414> their asses<WH2543> provender.<WH4554>

And they made ready<WH3559> <WH853> the present<WH4503> against<WH5704> Joseph<WH3130> came<WH935> at noon:<WH6672> for<WH3588> they heard<WH8085> that<WH3588> they should eat<WH398> bread<WH3899> there.<WH8033>

And when Joseph<WH3130> came<WH935> home,<WH1004> they brought<WH935> him<WH853> the present<WH4503> which<WH834> was in their hand<WH3027> into the house,<WH1004> and bowed themselves<WH7812> to him to the earth.<WH776>
And he asked<WH7592> them of their welfare,<WH7965> and said,<WH559> Is your father<WH1> well,<WH7965> the old man<WH2205> of whom<WH834> ye spoke?<WH559> Is he yet<WH5750> alive?<WH2416>
And they answered,<WH559> Thy servant<WH5650> our father<WH1> is in good health,<WH7965> he is yet<WH5750> alive.<WH2416> And they bowed down their heads,<WH6915> and made obeisance.<WH7812>

And he lifted up<WH5375> his eyes,<WH5869> and saw<WH7200> his brother<WH251> <WH853> Benjamin,<WH1144> his mother's<WH517> son,<WH1121> and said,<WH559> Is this<WH2088> your younger<WH6996> brother,<WH251> of whom<WH834> ye spoke<WH559> unto<WH413> me? And he said,<WH559> God<WH430> be gracious<WH2603> unto thee, my son.<WH1121>

And Joseph<WH3130> made haste;<WH4116> for<WH3588> his bowels<WH7356> did yearn<WH3648> upon<WH413> his brother:<WH251> and he sought<WH1245> where to weep;<WH1058> and he entered into<WH935> his chamber,<WH2315> and wept<WH1058> there.<WH8033>
And he washed<WH7364> his face,<WH6440> and went out,<WH3318> and refrained himself,<WH662> and said,<WH559> Set on<WH7760> bread.<WH3899>

And they set on<WH7760> for him by himself,<WH905> and for them by themselves,<WH905> and for the Egyptians,<WH4713> which did eat<WH398> with<WH854> him, by themselves:<WH905> because<WH3588> the Egyptians<WH4713> might<WH3201> not<WH3808> eat<WH398> bread<WH3899> with<WH854> the Hebrews;<WH5680> for<WH3588> that<WH1931> is an abomination<WH8441> unto the Egyptians.<WH4714>

And they sat<WH3427> before<WH6440> him, the firstborn<WH1060> according to his birthright,<WH1062> and the youngest<WH6810> according to his youth:<WH6812> and the men<WH376> marveled<WH8539> one<WH376> at<WH413> another.<WH7453>

And he took<WH5375> and sent messes<WH4864> unto<WH413> them from<WH4480> <WH854> before<WH6440> him: but Benjamin's<WH1144> mess<WH4864> was five times so much as<WH7235> <WH4480> <WH4864> <WH2568> <WH3027> any<WH3605> of theirs. And they drank,<WH8354> and were merry<WH7937> with<WH5973> him.
